meaningMnemonic:
澄む is "to become clear" - this is when you make something clear, because you <reading>mus</reading>t (ます) make it clear. You have to. That's why this is or <vocabulary>to make something clear</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to clear something</vocabulary>.

This can also mean <vocabulary>to strain</vocabulary> when used together with 耳, as in 耳を澄ます, "to strain one's ears".
readingMnemonic: The reading is the same as the kanji, so if you know that, that'll make this answer clear too.
